Package org.javascool

This is the JavaScool core Java and Xml bundle.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Editor Indicates that this class is a graphic editor that get/set text.
JsMain.Activity Defines a JavaScool interactive activity.
Proglet Indique que la classe est une proglet.
Widget Indicates that this class is a graphic widget.
 

Class Summary
AlgoEditor This widget defines a re-oriented graohic algorithm editor.
CurveOutput This widget defines a multi-curve output.
Eml Defines an expression as a PML data structure.
Hml Defines a text as a PML data structure.
HtmlDisplay Defines a panel in which a HTML text is shown.
IconOutput This widget defines a pixelic color icon panel.
JsFileChooser Defines the JavaScool v3-2 file load/save interactions.
JsFrame Defines the general frame of the JavaScool v3-2 interface in terms of a button toolbar and splitted tab panes.
JsMain Defines the JavaScool v3-2 launcher.
JsProcessingActivities This factory defines the different JavaScool v3-2 processing activities.
JsProglet Définit une «proglet», c'est à dire un objet numérique programmable qui, ici, s'intègre dans JavaScool.
JsProgletActivities This factory defines the different JavaScool v3-2 proglet activities.
JsProgletActivities.JavaActivity Defines a compilation activity.
Jvs2Java This factory defines how a Jvs code is translated into a Java code and compiled.
JvsSourceEditor This widget defines a Jvs code source editor.
LinkCheck This factory encapsulates a java implemented link check.
Macros Cette factory contient des functions générales rendues visibles à l'utilisateur de proglets.
NumberInput This widget defines a numeric input.
Pml Defines a PML: a Pml (Programmatic Markup Language) Memory Loader.
PmlSourceEditor This widget defines a Pml structure source editor.
ProgletApplet Defines a proglet applet.
Sampler Defines the implementation of a periodic task.
SoundBit This widget defines a sound bit and allows to use sampled sound resources.
SourceEditor This widget defines a general proglet source editor.
TraceOutput This widget defines a trace output.
Utils This factory contains useful methods to interface javascool with the environment.
 

Package org.javascool Description

This is the JavaScool core Java and Xml bundle.

Français/French

Ce package Java implémente les mécanismes JavaScool des «proglets» destinées à s'initier à la programmation à partir du niveau du lycée (niveau ``L0´´).

Il permet bien évidemment d'utiliser toute l'API Java.

Les documents utilisés sont écrits en Hml (c'est à dire en syntaxe XML ou en Pml avec des constructions prédéfinies pour simplifier l'écriture. Ils peuvent aussi être écrits sur le wiki.

Les classes utilisées par l'«élève» sont documentées en français. Les classes utilitaires utilisées pour créer/adapter des proglets sont documentées an anglais. Un wiki permet de partager des contenus et une forge de co-développer cet ensemble.

Anglais/English

This Java package implements the core of JavaScool of «proglets» to be used in order to learn programming, starting at the high-school level.

It indeed allows to use all the Java API.

Documents are to be written using the Hml constructs (using the XML or Pml syntax), with predefined constructs allowing to simplify the writing. They can also be written on the wiki.

Classes used by students are documented in French. Core classes Classes used to create/adapt proglets are documented in English. A wiki (in French) allows to share information and a forge to co-develop this bundle.

XSLT translation rules
hml2htm This XSLT translates HML code to HTML 4 output.
htm2hml This XSLT translates HTNML to HML constructs.
hdoc2htm This XSLT translates the proglet's HML documentation to HTML3.2.

org.javascool standalone interfaces

  • Usage: java org.javascool.JsMain [activity [file-name]]: Starts a JavaScool (V3) "activity" which result is to be stored in a "file-name".
  • Usage: java org.javascool.Jvs2Java [-reformat] [-compile] input-file: Translates Jvs files to Java files. Optionally reformat the Jvs code and/or compile the java classes.
  • Usage: java org.javascool.Pml input-file [output-file]: Checks the well-formedness of a file by mirroring its structure in a normalized PML format, the file extension defines the format.
  • Usage: java org.javascool.Hml input-file [output-file]: Checks the well-formedness of a file by mirroring its structure in a normalized HML format, the file extension defines the format.
  • Usage: java org.javascool.ProgletApplet proglet: Runs the demo of proglet.
  • Usage: java org.javascool.HtmlDisplay location: Show a HTML3.2 page.
  • Usage: java org.javascool.LinkCheck [-recursive] location: Checks links in the HTML text at the given HTTP location, and optionnaly recurse in sub-directories.
other standalone interfaces being used for debugging purposes,
